titleStmt.title: James R. Page to J. Saige Dury
CWG4502

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky,
OFFICE SECRETARY OF STATE,
Frankfort, 23d Dec, 1863.
Dear Sir:

Yrs of the 15th inst is at hand. & in reply I am directed to say that as soon as you notify him that Frank Tinche has volunteered & has been mustered into service- he will remit the Judgment against him

Yrs Respectfully
Jas R. Page
Asst Sec
Mr Nesbitt- from the above you will see what is necessary in the Tinches case
The within named Frank Tincher enlisted in my Company as a private has been ^mustered^ sworn in and his name is ^on the muster roll^ on record in the Adjutant General office in Frankfort Ky-

J, C, Bussey
Capt, Bath Rangers

Bath Cir Ct
vs
Frank Tincher
Tipling
Remtd 5th Jany 1864
